material.mattext: Recall that males' height follows a normal distribution with mean 69 inches and standard deviation 2.8 inches. Using R, answer the following: (a) How tall must a male be, in order to be among the shortest 0.5% of males? (b) How tall must a male be, in order to be among the tallest 0.25% of males?

(a) Here we need to find the value x that satisfies P(X < x) = 0.005. R provides:
> qnorm(0.005, mean=69, sd=2.8) [1] 61.78768
So, in order for a male to be among the shortest 0.5% of males, he needs to be less than 61.8 inches tall.
(b) Here we need to find the value x that satisfies P(X > x) = 0.0025, or P(X < x) = 0.9975. R provides:
> qnorm(0.9975, mean=69, sd=2.8) [1] 76.8597
So, in order for a male to be among the tallest 0.25% of males, he needs to be more than 76.9 inches tall.
